formulas.name: CalcAge
formulas.expression: IF( NOT( ISBLANK( {!DOB} ) ) , IF( DATE( 2000 , MONTH( {!DOB} ) , DAY( {!DOB} ) ) <= DATE( 2000 , MONTH( TODAY() ) , DAY( TODAY() ) ), YEAR (Today()) - YEAR ( {!DOB} ), YEAR (Today()) - YEAR ( {!DOB} ) -1 ), null)

fields.name: CompletedMsg
fields.fieldText: Thank you for completing your We Can Ride Volunteer application!

fields.name: AssumptionofRiskTXT
fields.fieldText:
2021 Release and Waiver of Liability


The undersigned Participant (the “Participant” or I) desires to participate in the activities with We Can Ride, Inc., a Minnesota non-profit corporation, including without limitation, being on the property owned or used by We Can Ride, Inc. and engaging with or being near horses (the “ Activities”). In consideration of being allowed to participate in the Activities, Participant hereby agrees, on behalf of Participant, and Participant’s personal representatives, assigns, heirs, next of kin, and any other successors-in-interest who are bound by the terms of this Release, as follows:


ACCEPTANCE OF RISK. I UNDERSTAND THAT EQUINE ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION, RIDING, HANDLING, AND BEING NEAR HORSES, AND BEING ON THE PROPERTY OF WE CAN RIDE, INC. HAVE MANY DANGERS AND RISKS AND CAN RESULT IN PERSONAL INJURY, DEATH AND/OR PROPERTY DAMAGE. I desire to be a part of the Activities and understand and accept that participating in the Activities may entail risks to myself, to others, and to property, and that my participation in the Activities is at my own risk.


Under Minnesota Law, We Can Ride, Inc. is not liable for personal injury, death or property damage resulting from the inherent risks of equine activities. Pursuant to Minn. Stat. § 604.055, nothing in this Agreement purports or intends to waive liability for damages injuries, or death resulting from conduct that constitutes greater than ordinary negligence.


RELEASE AND INDEMNITY


I agree to release, hold harmless and indemnify We Can Ride, Inc., its owners, agents, employees, officers, directors, representatives, therapists, volunteers, assigns, members, owners of premises and trails, affiliated organizations, insurers, and others acting on its behalf (“Representatives”), from any and all present or future claims, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of whatever kind or nature, including attorneys’ fees (Liability), whether in law or equity, arising from the Activities, including, without limitation, We Can Ride Inc.’s alleged failure to comply with applicable laws and regulations or any liability for personal injury, death or property damage which results from the ordinary negligence of We Can Ride, Inc. or its Representatives.


IN NO EVENT SHALL WE CAN RIDE, INC. HAVE ANY LIABILITY FOR CONSEQUENTIAL, INDIRECT, SPECIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, WHETHER BASED IN TORT OR CONTRACT, OR WHETHER WE CAN RIDE, INC. KNEW OR SHOULD HAVE KNOWN THE LIKELIHOOD OF SUCH DAMAGES.


OTHER


We Can Ride, Inc. does not assume any responsibility to provide Participant with financial or other assistance, including, but not limited to, medical insurance, health insurance, or disability benefits (other than as may be specified in a written employment agreement). We Can Ride, Inc. shall not be liable for the loss of, theft of, or damages to any personal property of Participant. This Release shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Minnesota and is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by law. If any of the provisions of this Release is held invalid, illegal or unenforceable, the validity, legality or enforceability of the remaining provisions shall not be affected.

fields.name: GoverningLawTXT
fields.fieldText:
BY SIGNING THIS RELEASE, I EXPRESSLY STATE THAT I HAVE READ AND UNDERSTAND ITS TERMS AND THAT I HAVE GIVEN UP SUBSTANTIAL RIGHTS AND THAT I INDICATE MY INTENT TO ENTER INTO THIS RELEASE KNOWINGLY AND VOLUNTARILY.
 
IF SIGNING AS PARENT/GUARDIAN, BY SIGNING THIS RELEASE, I CERTIFY THAT I AM THE PARENT OR LEGAL GUARDIAN OF THE PARTICIPANT, THAT I HAVE LEGAL AUTHORITY OVER PARTICIPANT, THAT I HAVE READ AND UNDERSTAND THE TERMS OF THIS RELEASE, AND THAT I FREELY SIGN THIS RELEASE AND WILL ABIDE BY ITS TERMS FOR MYSELF AND ON BEHALF OF THE PARTICIPANT.

fields.fieldText: Your email address is currently on file, we have sent you an email to ({!SendEmailAddress}) please click on the link in your inbox.

screens.name: CONFIDENTIALITY_RELEASE
screens.label: ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF HANDBOOK AND CONFIDENTIALITY POLICY

fields.name: CONFIDENTIALITYRELEASEText
fields.fieldText: I have received a current copy of the We Can Ride, Inc. Volunteer Handbook that contains volunteer policies and procedures, including, without limitation, the Confidentiality Policy. I acknowledge that I have read the Volunteer Handbook and understand that I am responsible for acting in accordance with the policies and procedures of We Can Ride, Inc. We Can Ride, Inc. retains the right to modify, amend, or change policies and procedures in the Volunteer Handbook at any time. Volunteers will be notified in advance of any changes. The Handbook can we found on www.wecanride.org under Volunteer information.

fields.name: Guardian_text
fields.fieldText: Parent/Guardian must "Consent" if Volunteer is under 18

fields.name: SkillSec1
fields.fieldText: Other Languages

fields.name: SkillsSec2
fields.fieldText:
Abilities
Volunteering in class with We Can Ride can sometimes be very physically and emotionally demanding.

fields.name: WalkWeightButtons
fields.fieldText: Can you walk for 60 minutes without fatiguing; jog for a short distance; & hold your arm above shoulder height?

fields.name: SkillSec3
fields.fieldText:
Interests
Note: We will contact you about training prior to starting. Also, you must participate in at least one session as a sidewalker before becoming a leader or barn aide.

fields.name: SkillsSec4
fields.fieldText:
Sidewalkers- work with the client by walking alongside the horse during class. They help the client understand the instructor’s directions, achieve balance, independence, and reach personal goals.
Feeder- Help feed our herd one day a week. Feeders get trained by the Barn Manager and are placed with 1-2 other feeders.
Leader- Lead the horse in lessons making sure the horse is safe & well behaved. Arrive at least 20 minutes early to warm up the horse. Attend and successfully pass leader training to become a leader.
Barn Aide- Catch, groom, tack, untack and release the horses after lessons. Arrive at least an hour early to get horses ready. Must already be trained as a leader and been a leader in one session. Attend and successfully pass barn aide training. You will then shadow the barn aides on the day you volunteer for one session for more training.
Events, Office Tasks, Committees- No training needed to help.

fields.name: walkliftwarningText
fields.fieldText: You have indicated you cannot meet one of the minimum requirements to volunteer in class or feed. However, we would welcome you volunteering in other ways (office, events). If you wish to do these, please click Previous to edit your entry. Or click Finish to cancel your registration.

fields.fieldText: Welcome! Please complete the online registration to Volunteer with We Can Ride.

textTemplates.name: emailBody
textTemplates.text:
You have a volunteer record with We Can Ride. Please click on the following link to update your record details. Thank you!


https://wecanride.force.com/forms/s/contact?Id={!sobjContact.Id}


The We Can Ride Volunteer Team



﻿
